usedText.ocrText:
1 | COMP801 – THE EXERCISE IS DEVELOPED BASED ON CSIT110/CSIT810
COMP801 – WEEK 1 – EXERCISES 
 
OBJECTIVES  
 Able to use different data types 
 Able to use the print() function to display information or outputs 
 Able to covert values from string to integer or vice versa 
 
BACKGROUND: 
You are given the following code: 
subjectCode = “MATH123” 
subjectName = “Fundamental Mathematic” 
subjectCredit = “6 credit points” 
totalStudents = 300 
totalDMarks = “25” 
aveFinalMark = 73.2022 
 
USEFUL FUNCTIONS: 
 type (x) : get the data type of variable x 
 print (x): print the value of x on the screen 
 int(x): convert x from a string to an integer value 
 str(x): convert x from an integer to a string value 
 
QUESTIONS:  
For each of the following questions, you have to write a python code, run it, and check your answer. 
1) What is the data type of each variables for the given code? 
2) What is the output of the code below? 
print(“subjectCode + subjectName + totalStudents”)

2 | COMP801 – THE EXERCISE IS DEVELOPED BASED ON CSIT110/CSIT810
3) What is the output of the following statement? 
print(“I like the subject.”) 
4) Write a statement to print out your full name 
5) What is the result of the below statement? 
print(subjectCode) 
6) What is the output of the following code? 
print(subjectCode + “subjectName + totalStudents”) 
7) What is the output of the following code? 
print(subjectCode + “, ” + subjectName + “, ” + “totalStudents”) 
8) Write one print statement using the above variables and string addition to produce 
exactly the following result? 
MATH123 – Fundamental Mathematic subject has 6 credit points. 
9) Write one print statement using the above variables and string addition to produce 
exactly the following result? 
MATH123 – Fundamental Mathematic subject has “6 credit points”. 
10) Write one print statement using the above variables and string addition to produce 
exactly the following result? 
MATH123: 300 enrolled students, 73.2022 % average final grade. 
11) What is the result of the following statement? 
print(totalStudents - totalDMarks) 
12) What is the result of the following statements? 
x = int(totalDMarks) 
print(x)

3 | COMP801 – THE EXERCISE IS DEVELOPED BASED ON CSIT110/CSIT810
13) What is the result of the following statement? 
print(totalStudents - int(totalDMarks)) 
14) What is the result of the following statements? 
x = str(totalStudents) 
print(totalStudents - totalDMarks) 
15) What is the result of the following statements? 
print(“COMP801”) 
print(“Python Programming for Cyber Security”) 
print(“Session 1 - 2023”) 
16) What is the result of the following statements? 
print(“COMP801”) 
print() 
print(“Python Programming for Cyber Security”) 
print() 
print(“Session 1 - 2023”) 
17) What is the result of the following statements? 
print(“COMP801”, end = “, ”) 
print(“Python Programming for Cyber Security”, end = “, ”) 
print(“Session 1 - 2023”) 
18) What is the result of the following statements? 
print(“COMP801”, end = “, ”) 
print(“Python Programming for Cyber Security”, end = “, ”)

4 | COMP801 – THE EXERCISE IS DEVELOPED BASED ON CSIT110/CSIT810
print(“Session 1 - 2023”) 
19) What is the result of the following statements? 
x = "ngoc" 
x1 = "ngoc" 
x2 = "ngoc " 
x3 = " ngoc" 
x4 = "Ngoc" 
x5 = "NGOC" 
x6 = "ngoc1" 
print("Type of x and x6 is the same? :", type(x) == type(x6)) 
print("Compare value of x with values of x1, x2, x3, x4,x5,x6") 
print("compare "+ x + " with "+ x1 + ": ", x == x1) 
print("compare "+ x + " with "+ x2 + ": ", x == x2) 
print("compare "+ x + " with "+ x3 + ": ", x == x3) 
print("compare "+ x + " with "+ x4 + ": ", x == x4) 
print("compare "+ x + " with "+ x5 + ": ", x == x5) 
print("compare "+ x + " with "+ x6 + ": ", x == x6)
usedText.referenceText:
COMP8O1 - WEEK 1 - EXERCISES

OBJECTIVES
> Able to use different data types
>» Able to use the print() function to display information or outputs

> Able to covert values from string to integer or vice versa
BACKGROUND:
You are given the following code:

subjectCode = "MATH123"

subjectName = "Fundamental Mathematic"

subjectCredit "6 credit points"

totalStudents = 300
totalDMarks = "25"

aveFinalMark = 73.2022

USEFUL FUNCTIONS:
> type (x) : get the data type of variable x
> print (x): print the value of x on the screen
> int(x): convert x from a string to an integer value

> str(x): convert x from an integer to a string value

QUESTIONS:
1. What is the data type of the variable totalStudents?
A. str
B. float
C. int
D. bool
Correct Answer: C

2. What is the output of print("subjectCode + subjectName + totalStudents")?
A. MATH123Fundamental Mathematic300
B. subjectCode + subjectName + totalStudents
C. Error
D. MATH123 + Fundamental Mathematic + 300
Correct Answer: B

3. What is the output of print("I like the subject.")?
A. I like the subject.
B. print("I like the subject.")
C. Error
D. subject
Correct Answer: A

4. Which statement correctly prints your full name?
A. print(John Smith)
B. print("Full Name")
C. print("John Smith")
D. print('John', 'Smith')
Correct Answer: C

5. What is the output of print(subjectCode)?
A. subjectCode
B. MATH123
C. "subjectCode"
D. Error
Correct Answer: B

6. What is the output of print(subjectCode + "subjectName + totalStudents")?
A. subjectCode subjectName totalStudents
B. MATH123 Fundamental Mathematic 300
C. MATH123subjectName + totalStudents
D. Error
Correct Answer: C

7. What is the output of print(subjectCode + ", " + subjectName + ", " + "totalStudents")?
A. MATH123, Fundamental Mathematic, totalStudents
B. MATH123, Fundamental Mathematic, 300
C. subjectCode, subjectName, totalStudents
D. Error
Correct Answer: A

8. Which print() statement outputs:
MATH123 – Fundamental Mathematic subject has 6 credit points.
A. print(subjectCode, "-", subjectName, "subject has", subjectCredit)
B. print(subjectCode + " – " + subjectName + " subject has " + subjectCredit + ".")
C. print("MATH123 – Fundamental Mathematic subject has 6 credit points.")
D. All of the above
Correct Answer: B

9. How would you output:
MATH123 – Fundamental Mathematic subject has "6 credit points".
A. print(subjectCode + " – " + subjectName + " subject has " + subjectCredit + ".")
B. print(subjectCode + " – " + subjectName + " subject has "" + subjectCredit + "".")
C. print(subjectCode + subjectName + subjectCredit)
D. print("MATH123 - Fundamental Mathematic subject has "6 credit points".")
Correct Answer: B

10. What is the output of:
print(subjectCode + ": " + str(totalStudents) + " enrolled students, " + str(aveFinalMark) + " % average final grade.")
A. MATH123: 300 enrolled students, 73.2022 % average final grade.
B. MATH123: totalStudents enrolled students, aveFinalMark % average final grade.
C. Error
D. MATH123 – 300 – 73.2022
Correct Answer: A

11. What happens when you run: print(totalStudents - totalDMarks)?
A. 275
B. 25
C. Error due to type mismatch
D. "275"
Correct Answer: C

12. What is the result of this code?
python
CopyEdit
x = int(totalDMarks)  
print(x)  
A. "25"
B. 25
C. Error
D. None
Correct Answer: B

13. What is the result of print(totalStudents - int(totalDMarks))?
A. 275
B. 25
C. Error
D. None
Correct Answer: A

14. What is the result of the code below?
x = str(totalStudents)  
print(totalStudents - totalDMarks)  
A. 275
B. Error due to incompatible types
C. "275"
D. totalStudents - totalDMarks
Correct Answer: B

15. What is the output of the following code?
print("COMP801")
print("Python Programming for Cyber Security")
print("Session 1 - 2023")
A. Three lines with each phrase
B. One line with all three phrases
C. Error
D. None
Correct Answer: A

16. What is the result of adding empty print() statements?
print("COMP801")
print()
print("Python Programming for Cyber Security")
print()
print("Session 1 - 2023")
A. Same as Q15
B. Adds blank lines between outputs
C. One line output
D. Error
Correct Answer: B

17. What is the result of the code below?
print("COMP801", end=", ")
print("Python Programming for Cyber Security", end=", ")
print("Session 1 - 2023")
A. Each phrase on its own line
B. All phrases on one line separated by commas
C. Error
D. Missing comma
Correct Answer: B

18. Which is true about using end=", " in print()?
A. It prints all values on one line
B. It separates values with a comma
C. It prevents the next line from starting a new row
D. All of the above
Correct Answer: D

19. What is the result of comparing x = "ngoc" to other variables like "ngoc ", "Ngoc" and "NGOC"?
A. All comparisons are True
B. Comparisons fail due to casing and whitespace
C. Only x == x1 is True
D. B and C
Correct Answer: D

"answer":  [ {{ "criterion": "...", "marks": 2 }}, … ]
}}

print(“COMP801”, end = “, ”)

print(“Session 1 - 2023”) 
19) What is the result of the following statements? 
x = "ngoc" 
x1 = "ngoc" 
x2 = "ngoc " 
x3 = " ngoc" 
x4 = "Ngoc" 
x5 = "NGOC" 
x6 = "ngoc1" 
print("Type of x and x6 is the same? :", type(x) == type(x6)) 
print("Compare value of x with values of x1, x2, x3, x4,x5,x6") 
print("compare "+ x + " with "+ x1 + ": ", x == x1) 
print("compare "+ x + " with "+ x2 + ": ", x == x2) 
print("compare "+ x + " with "+ x3 + ": ", x == x3) 
print("compare "+ x + " with "+ x4 + ": ", x == x4) 
print("compare "+ x + " with "+ x5 + ": ", x == x5) 
print("compare "+ x + " with "+ x6 + ": ", x == x6)

COMP8O1 - WEEK 1 - EXERCISES

OBJECTIVES
> Able to use different data types
>» Able to use the print() function to display information or outputs

> Able to covert values from string to integer or vice versa
BACKGROUND:
You are given the following code:

subjectCode = "MATH123"

subjectName = "Fundamental Mathematic"

subjectCredit "6 credit points"

totalStudents = 300
totalDMarks = "25"

aveFinalMark = 73.2022

USEFUL FUNCTIONS:
> type (x) : get the data type of variable x
> print (x): print the value of x on the screen
> int(x): convert x from a string to an integer value

> str(x): convert x from an integer to a string value

QUESTIONS:
1. What is the data type of the variable totalStudents?
A. str
B. float
C. int
D. bool
Correct Answer: C

2. What is the output of print("subjectCode + subjectName + totalStudents")?
A. MATH123Fundamental Mathematic300
B. subjectCode + subjectName + totalStudents
C. Error
D. MATH123 + Fundamental Mathematic + 300
Correct Answer: B

3. What is the output of print("I like the subject.")?
A. I like the subject.
B. print("I like the subject.")
C. Error
D. subject
Correct Answer: A

4. Which statement correctly prints your full name?
A. print(John Smith)
B. print("Full Name")
C. print("John Smith")
D. print('John', 'Smith')
Correct Answer: C

5. What is the output of print(subjectCode)?
A. subjectCode
B. MATH123
C. "subjectCode"
D. Error
Correct Answer: B

6. What is the output of print(subjectCode + "subjectName + totalStudents")?
A. subjectCode subjectName totalStudents
B. MATH123 Fundamental Mathematic 300
C. MATH123subjectName + totalStudents
D. Error
Correct Answer: C

7. What is the output of print(subjectCode + ", " + subjectName + ", " + "totalStudents")?
A. MATH123, Fundamental Mathematic, totalStudents
B. MATH123, Fundamental Mathematic, 300
C. subjectCode, subjectName, totalStudents
D. Error
Correct Answer: A

8. Which print() statement outputs:
MATH123 – Fundamental Mathematic subject has 6 credit points.
A. print(subjectCode, "-", subjectName, "subject has", subjectCredit)
B. print(subjectCode + " – " + subjectName + " subject has " + subjectCredit + ".")
C. print("MATH123 – Fundamental Mathematic subject has 6 credit points.")
D. All of the above
Correct Answer: B

9. How would you output:
MATH123 – Fundamental Mathematic subject has "6 credit points".
A. print(subjectCode + " – " + subjectName + " subject has " + subjectCredit + ".")
B. print(subjectCode + " – " + subjectName + " subject has "" + subjectCredit + "".")
C. print(subjectCode + subjectName + subjectCredit)
D. print("MATH123 - Fundamental Mathematic subject has "6 credit points".")
Correct Answer: B

10. What is the output of:
print(subjectCode + ": " + str(totalStudents) + " enrolled students, " + str(aveFinalMark) + " % average final grade.")
A. MATH123: 300 enrolled students, 73.2022 % average final grade.
B. MATH123: totalStudents enrolled students, aveFinalMark % average final grade.
C. Error
D. MATH123 – 300 – 73.2022
Correct Answer: A

11. What happens when you run: print(totalStudents - totalDMarks)?
A. 275
B. 25
C. Error due to type mismatch
D. "275"
Correct Answer: C

12. What is the result of this code?
python
CopyEdit
x = int(totalDMarks)  
print(x)  
A. "25"
B. 25
C. Error
D. None
Correct Answer: B

13. What is the result of print(totalStudents - int(totalDMarks))?
A. 275
B. 25
C. Error
D. None
Correct Answer: A

14. What is the result of the code below?
x = str(totalStudents)  
print(totalStudents - totalDMarks)  
A. 275
B. Error due to incompatible types
C. "275"
D. totalStudents - totalDMarks
Correct Answer: B

15. What is the output of the following code?
print("COMP801")
print("Python Programming for Cyber Security")
print("Session 1 - 2023")
A. Three lines with each phrase
B. One line with all three phrases
C. Error
D. None
Correct Answer: A

16. What is the result of adding empty print() statements?
print("COMP801")
print()
print("Python Programming for Cyber Security")
print()
print("Session 1 - 2023")
A. Same as Q15
B. Adds blank lines between outputs
C. One line output
D. Error
Correct Answer: B

17. What is the result of the code below?
print("COMP801", end=", ")
print("Python Programming for Cyber Security", end=", ")
print("Session 1 - 2023")
A. Each phrase on its own line
B. All phrases on one line separated by commas
C. Error
D. Missing comma
Correct Answer: B

18. Which is true about using end=", " in print()?
A. It prints all values on one line
B. It separates values with a comma
C. It prevents the next line from starting a new row
D. All of the above
Correct Answer: D

19. What is the result of comparing x = "ngoc" to other variables like "ngoc ", "Ngoc" and "NGOC"?
A. All comparisons are True
B. Comparisons fail due to casing and whitespace
C. Only x == x1 is True
D. B and C
Correct Answer: D

19) What is the result of the following statements? 
x = "ngoc" 
x1 = "ngoc" 
x2 = "ngoc " 
x3 = " ngoc" 
x4 = "Ngoc" 
x5 = "NGOC" 
x6 = "ngoc1" 
print("Type of x and x6 is the same? :", type(x) == type(x6)) 
print("Compare value of x with values of x1, x2, x3, x4,x5,x6") 
print("compare "+ x + " with "+ x1 + ": ", x == x1) 
print("compare "+ x + " with "+ x2 + ": ", x == x2) 
print("compare "+ x + " with "+ x3 + ": ", x == x3) 
print("compare "+ x + " with "+ x4 + ": ", x == x4) 
print("compare "+ x + " with "+ x5 + ": ", x == x5) 
print("compare "+ x + " with "+ x6 + ": ", x == x6)
